newsitem.title: USA: U.S. LPG stable in very quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. LPG stable in very quiet trade.

text.p: U.S. spot liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) prices were stable in very quiet late trade on Thursday amid a slight gain in NYMEX crude oil futures, players said.
In the U.S. Gulf Coast, spot propane remained between 39.25 cents and 39.50 cents a gallon, after falling a half cent on government inventory data showing a 300,000 barrel draw in stocks for the hub.
The Midwest also remained stable at 37.50/38.00 cents in little talk.
The butane markets were also quiet.
Meanwhile, traders said they have seen a significant drop in demand by petrochemical companies by at least 50,000 barrels per day. ((--Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk 1212 859-1631))
